body:
Comment 5: 
In this case the explicit type is interface{}.  Since that doesn't convey any useful
numeric type, the numeric type chosen is int.  That int value is then converted to
interface{}.  Then the rules for comparing interfaces apply.

Your suggestion appears to be that the dynamic type of the interface should be used to
determine the type of the constant.  In the general case that is either impossible or
very expensive.  It's not how Go works.
